summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Activity Log feature for company admin dashboard. All 14 backend API tests pass (100%). Frontend UI tested successfully - Activity Log tab visible, table displays correctly with all columns, and filters work.
passed_tests: GET /api/logs/me returns {logs, total, skip, limit} format
Log entries have required fields (id, user_id, user_name, user_email, user_role, action, resource_type, description, timestamp)
Default pagination limit is 50
Custom skip/limit pagination parameters work
Action filter (login/create/update/delete) works
Resource type filter (auth/job/application) works
Search filter searches across user_name, user_email, description
Date range filter (start_date, end_date) works
Combined filters work together
Login via /api/auth/select-company creates activity log
Job create via POST /api/jobs-session creates activity log
Job update via PUT /api/jobs-session/{id} creates activity log
Job delete via DELETE /api/jobs-session/{id} creates activity log
Unauthenticated request to /api/logs/me returns 401
Frontend: Log Aktivitas tab visible in admin dashboard (5th tab)
Frontend: Table shows columns - User, Aksi, Resource, Deskripsi, Waktu
Frontend: Action type dropdown filter works
Frontend: Resource type dropdown filter works
Frontend: Date range inputs present and functional
Frontend: Search input and button work
Frontend: Refresh button works
Frontend: Reset Filter button works
Frontend: Log count displayed (X log ditemukan)
seed_data_creation: Test job created and deleted during tests - no permanent test data left
context_for_next_testing_agent: Activity Log feature fully tested. Backend endpoint at GET /api/logs/me with session-based auth (cookies). Frontend component at ActivityLogTab.jsx. Activity logs created on: login (select-company), job CRUD (create/update/delete), application status update, soft delete, restore, permanent delete. Table columns: User, Aksi, Resource, Deskripsi, Waktu. Pagination shows max 50 items per page. Note: Pagination prev/next buttons only appear when total > 50 logs.

backend_api.response_format: {logs: [], total: int, skip: int, limit: int}
